de.unlixx.runpng.png.chunks

Class PngTransparency

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.unlixx.runpng.png.chunks.PngTransparency

  • public class PngTransparency
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements the transparency chunk (tRNS) for the color types 0, 2 and 3. This chunk can appear 0 or 1 time in a png file. In case of indexed color (type 3) this is a table in conjunction with the PngPalette chunk (PLTE). In case of truecolor (type 2) and greyscale (type 0) this is a color sample with a byte length of 6 or 2.
    See Also:
    https://www.w3.org/TR/PNG/#11tRNS, http://www.libpng.org/pub/png/spec/1.2/PNG-Chunks.html 
    There seems to be an error in the byte order of colors at w3.org. RBG instead of RGB.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PngTransparency

        public PngTransparency(PngColorType colorType,
                       int nBitDepth,
                       byte[] abtRNS)
        Constructor for use in conjunction with a PngPalette.
        Parameters:
        colorType - A PngColorType enum type.
        nBitDepth - An int containing the bit depth.
        abtRNS - A byte array containing alpha values for use in conjunction with a color palette. This byte array length may be shorter than but must not exceed the color count of the palette.

      • PngTransparency

        public PngTransparency(PngColorType colorType,
                       int nBitDepth,
                       int ntRNS)
        Constructor for use with greyscale (type 0) and truecolor (type 2). It takes a color sample with a color treated as transparent in the bitmap.
        Parameters:
        colorType - A PngColorType enum type.
        nBitDepth - An int containing the bit depth.
        ntRNS - An int containing the color sample treated as transparent.

    • Method Detail

      • gettRNS

        public long gettRNS()
        Gets a tRNS sample color as a long integer value.
        Returns:
        A long integer containing an appropriate sample color (in the 2 or 6 lower bytes).

      • getBytes

        public byte[] getBytes()
        Gets a 2 or 6 bytes long array for greyscale or truecolor. Or a variable length byte array for indexed color.
        Returns:
        An array of bytes according the colortype.
